docs.text:
Roid Macros


Vanilla macros on steroids!




Overview


Roid Macros is aimed to provide TBC like macros (including conditions!)
while abusing Vanilla WoW's Lua API to go even further including things
like executing macros from within macros! 


Further Information




Chat Commands


Conditions


#showtooltip


Macro invocation


Toggable abilities and channelled spells
docs.title: Home

docs.text: Vanilla macros on steroids!
docs.title: Roid Macros

while abusing Vanilla WoW's Lua API to go even further including things
like executing macros from within macros!

docs.text:
/equip and /equipoh


/equip
 puts an item with the given name into the main hand slot.


/equipoh
 puts an item with the given name into the off hand slot.


Examples


/equip Elementium Reinforced Bulwark




Will equip the Elementium Reinforced Bulwark if it can be found in the inventory.




/equipoh [equipped:Shields] Iblis, Blade of the Fallen Seraph




Will equip Iblis, Blade of the Fallen Seraph if you currently have a shield equipped.
docs.title: /equip and /equipoh

docs.text: /equip  puts an item with the given name into the main hand slot.  /equipoh  puts an item with the given name into the off hand slot.
docs.title: /equip and /equipoh

docs.text: /equip Elementium Reinforced Bulwark  Will equip the Elementium Reinforced Bulwark if it can be found in the inventory.   /equipoh [equipped:Shields] Iblis, Blade of the Fallen Seraph  Will equip Iblis, Blade of the Fallen Seraph if you currently have a shield equipped.
docs.title: Examples

docs.text:
/petattack


/petattack
 makes your pet attack.


Examples


/petattack [@focus]




You pet will attack your focus target (Refer to the 
Compatibility Notes
).




/petattack [@mouseover harm nodead]




Your pet will attack your mouseover target if it is attackable and not dead.
docs.title: /petattack

docs.text: /petattack  makes your pet attack.
docs.title: /petattack

docs.text: /petattack [@focus]  You pet will attack your focus target (Refer to the  Compatibility Notes ).   /petattack [@mouseover harm nodead]  Your pet will attack your mouseover target if it is attackable and not dead.
docs.title: Examples

docs.text:
A few words about /target macros


In theory, you can use every condition, however, a few of them behave a little
different in '/target' macros. Here's a list of them:


Definitions


A few definitions before we start:


final target


The unit that will be selected after evaluating every condition. E.g.

/target Ragnaros
 - Ragnaros will be the 
final target
.


checked target


The unit against which all conditions will be checked. E.g.

/target [harm @mouseover] Ragnaros
 - Your current mouseover target will be
the 
checked target
 while 
Ragnaros
 is still the 
final target
.




As stated before, instead of checking the final target, all conditions will
be validated against the checked target. This means that your checked target
may or may not be the same as your final target. This allows you to create more
specialized macros and, on top of that, is more intuitive to use.


Examples


/target [harm @mouseover] Ragnaros; Dotalock




This will target Ragnaros, if your mouseover target is hostile to yourself. If
it isn't the player Dotalock will be targeted instead.


Additionally, assume you want to target your mouseover target depending on
whether or not some pre-conditions are met. In Vanilla WoW, there is no way to
do something like that. With this AddOn, however, we can do things like this:


/target [harm @target] @targettarget




When you use this macro, you will target your target's target, if your current
target is considered hostile towards you.


Known issues


Assume you're assaulting a capital like Orgrimmar or Stormwind and you have a
macro like the following:


/target [harm @mouseover] @mouseover




Now you're trying to use this macro to select one of the city's guards that is
a fair bit away from you. Because of the way the Vanilla client implements
targeting by names, you're not guaranteed to target your mouseover target. This
will always happen when another unit with the same name is closer to you than
the desired unit. There is no way to work around this issue, as the actual
targeting procedure hasn't been implemented in Lua and is therefore out of
reach for AddOn developers.
docs.title: A few words about /target macros

different in '/target' macros. Here's a list of them:

it isn't the player Dotalock will be targeted instead.  Additionally, assume you want to target your mouseover target depending on
whether or not some pre-conditions are met. In Vanilla WoW, there is no way to
do something like that. With this AddOn, however, we can do things like this:  /target [harm @target] @targettarget  When you use this macro, you will target your target's target, if your current
target is considered hostile towards you.

docs.text:
Assume you're assaulting a capital like Orgrimmar or Stormwind and you have a
macro like the following:  /target [harm @mouseover] @mouseover  Now you're trying to use this macro to select one of the city's guards that is
a fair bit away from you. Because of the way the Vanilla client implements
targeting by names, you're not guaranteed to target your mouseover target. This
will always happen when another unit with the same name is closer to you than
the desired unit. There is no way to work around this issue, as the actual
targeting procedure hasn't been implemented in Lua and is therefore out of
reach for AddOn developers.
docs.title: Known issues

docs.text:
/unshift


/unshift
 make you leave your shapeshift form.


Examples


/unshift [stance:1/2/4]




This macro will cause you to exit your shapeshift form if you're either in [Dire] Bear Form, Aquatic Form, or Travel Form.




/unshift [stance:1/2/4]
/cast [stance:0] Cat Form; [nocombat nostealth] Prowl




You will exit any form other than Cat Form. Then, if you're not shapeshifted, you'll go into Cat Form. If you are in Cat Form you'll cast Prowl.
docs.title: /unshift

docs.text: /unshift  make you leave your shapeshift form.
docs.title: /unshift

docs.text:
/unshift [stance:1/2/4]  This macro will cause you to exit your shapeshift form if you're either in [Dire] Bear Form, Aquatic Form, or Travel Form.   /unshift [stance:1/2/4]
/cast [stance:0] Cat Form; [nocombat nostealth] Prowl  You will exit any form other than Cat Form. Then, if you're not shapeshifted, you'll go into Cat Form. If you are in Cat Form you'll cast Prowl.
docs.title: Examples

docs.text:
/use


/use
 allows you to use items from your inventory or equipped ones.


Examples


/use Juju Flurry




Will use Juju Flurry if it can be found in the inventory.




/use [@player] Runecloth Bandage




This macro will search for Runecloth Bandages in your inventory and if it finds them use them upon your character.




/use [combat] Major Mana Potion




With this line you'll never again use a Major Mana Potion accidentally when you're not in combat!
docs.title: /use

docs.text: /use  allows you to use items from your inventory or equipped ones.
docs.title: /use

docs.text: /use Juju Flurry  Will use Juju Flurry if it can be found in the inventory.   /use [@player] Runecloth Bandage  This macro will search for Runecloth Bandages in your inventory and if it finds them use them upon your character.   /use [combat] Major Mana Potion  With this line you'll never again use a Major Mana Potion accidentally when you're not in combat!
docs.title: Examples

docs.text:
/rl


/rl
 tells the client to reload all Addons. This is mainly used for debugging.
docs.title: /rl

docs.text: /rl  tells the client to reload all Addons. This is mainly used for debugging.
docs.title: /rl

docs.text:
Conditions


Conditions allow you to fine-tune your macro's behaviour without having to
know any Lua at all!




Notation


/command [condition] parameters




Conditions are put after the chat command but before the chat command's
parameters into square brackets.




/command [condition1 condition2] parameters




Conditions can be chained together by seperating them using an empty space. All
conditions must be met before the command is executed.




/command [condition:parameter] parameters




Some conditions may take parameters. These follow after a colon 
:
 or, in
some cases, after a greater than 
 or less than 
 sign.




/command [condition:1/2/3] parameters




Some conditions may take multiple parameters. These have to be seperated by
slashes 
/
.


Branches


When using conditions in your macros, it might be desirable to perform two
different actions that depend on both outcomes of a condition. While you could
in theory achieve this by repeating the inverted condition one line below,
you'll realise that this would lead to making your macros exceedingly bigger.
An example:


/cast [dead] Spell1
/cast [nodead] Spell2




Roid-Macros solves this by allowing you to branch off of the first set of
parameters, if the conditions fails, by seperating them with a semicolon 
;
 at
the end. The same example but now with a branch instead:


/cast [dead] Spell1; Spell2




Of course you could also put in more conditons in the different branches!


/cast [condition1] Healing Wave; [condition2] Windfury Totem; [condition3] Healing Wave (Rank 3); Frost Shock




Note, that you may use any spell you want within each condition. Also, there
mustn't be a whitespace character after each semicolon. You may, however, use
them to improve readability.




Supported Chat Commands


This is a list of all Chat Commands that support conditions:




/cast


/target


/equip


/equipoh


/petattack


/unshift


/use






Available Conditoins:




attacks / noattacks


(no)buff / (no)mybuff / (no)debuff / (no)mydebuff


channeled / nochanneled


combat / nocombat


cooldown / nocooldown


dead / nodead


equipped


group


help / harm


(my)hp


isnpc


isplayer


mod


party


(my)power / (my)rawpower


raid


stance


stealth / nostealth


type


UnitID
docs.title: Conditions

some cases, after a greater than   or less than   sign.   /command [condition:1/2/3] parameters  Some conditions may take multiple parameters. These have to be seperated by
slashes  / .

Also, there
mustn't be a whitespace character after each semicolon. You may, however, use

docs.text: This is a list of all Chat Commands that support conditions:   /cast  /target  /equip  /equipoh  /petattack  /unshift  /use
docs.title: Supported Chat Commands

docs.text: attacks / noattacks  (no)buff / (no)mybuff / (no)debuff / (no)mydebuff  channeled / nochanneled  combat / nocombat  cooldown / nocooldown  dead / nodead  equipped  group  help / harm  (my)hp  isnpc  isplayer  mod  party  (my)power / (my)rawpower  raid  stance  stealth / nostealth  type  UnitID
docs.title: Available Conditoins:

docs.text:
attacks / noattacks


This condition will only fire when your target's target is [not] the
specified target.


Parameters


The UnitID of the target that must [not] be attacking you. Refer to

target condition


Examples


/cast [attacks:player] {Yes}; {No}




This will execute the Macro with the name 
Yes
, if your target is currently
attacking you, and the Macro named 
No
 when it is not.
docs.title: attacks / noattacks

docs.text:
This condition will only fire when your target's target is [not] the
specified target.
docs.title: attacks / noattacks

docs.text: The UnitID of the target that must [not] be attacking you. Refer to target condition
docs.title: Parameters

docs.text:
/cast [attacks:player] {Yes}; {No}  This will execute the Macro with the name  Yes , if your target is currently
attacking you, and the Macro named  No  when it is not.
docs.title: Examples

docs.text:
[no]buff / [no]mybuff / [no]debuff / [no]mydebuff


Ensures that you (mybuff/mydebuff) or the specified target (buff/debuff) has
the given buff or debuff. May be inverted by adding a 'no' at the beginning.


Parameters


The name of the buff or debuff. May be abbreviated and mustn't contain anything
that isn't a letter from the English alphabet. White spaces must be replaced by
an underscore 
_
.


Examples


/cast [nobuff:Fortitude @mouseover] Power Word: Fortitude




Will cast Power Word: Fortitude on your mouseover target if no such buff could be found on it.




/cast [mybuff:Blood_Fury] Healing Wave




Will cast Healing Wave on yourself only while Blood Fury is active.




/cast [debuff:Curse_of_Weakness @player] Healing Wave




Will cast Healing Wave on yourself as long as Curse of Weakness is active.
docs.title: [no]buff / [no]mybuff / [no]debuff / [no]mydebuff

docs.text:
Ensures that you (mybuff/mydebuff) or the specified target (buff/debuff) has
the given buff or debuff. May be inverted by adding a 'no' at the beginning.
docs.title: [no]buff / [no]mybuff / [no]debuff / [no]mydebuff

docs.text:
The name of the buff or debuff. May be abbreviated and mustn't contain anything
that isn't a letter from the English alphabet. White spaces must be replaced by
an underscore  _ .
docs.title: Parameters

docs.text: /cast [nobuff:Fortitude @mouseover] Power Word: Fortitude  Will cast Power Word: Fortitude on your mouseover target if no such buff could be found on it.   /cast [mybuff:Blood_Fury] Healing Wave  Will cast Healing Wave on yourself only while Blood Fury is active.   /cast [debuff:Curse_of_Weakness @player] Healing Wave  Will cast Healing Wave on yourself as long as Curse of Weakness is active.
docs.title: Examples

docs.text:
channeled / nochanneled


This condition will only fire when you currently are [not] casting any
channeled spells.


Examples


/cast [nochanneled] Shadow Bolt




You will cast Shadow Bolt whenever you're not casting any channeled spells.
docs.title: channeled / nochanneled

docs.text:
This condition will only fire when you currently are [not] casting any
channeled spells.
docs.title: channeled / nochanneled

docs.text: /cast [nochanneled] Shadow Bolt  You will cast Shadow Bolt whenever you're not casting any channeled spells.
docs.title: Examples

docs.text:
combat / nocombat


May only be used in combat. Can be inverted by adding 
no
 in front of 
combat
.


Example:


/cast [nocombat] Starfire; Wrath




Your Oomkin will cast Starfire when you are not in combat and Wrath once you are.
docs.title: combat / nocombat

docs.text: May only be used in combat. Can be inverted by adding  no  in front of  combat .
docs.title: combat / nocombat

docs.text: /cast [nocombat] Starfire; Wrath  Your Oomkin will cast Starfire when you are not in combat and Wrath once you are.
docs.title: Example:

docs.text:
cooldown / nocooldown


This condition will only fire when the given name of a spell or item is
off/on cooldown.


Parameters


The name of the spell. White spaces must be replaced with an underscore 
_
.


Examples


/cast [nocooldown:Spell_Lock] Spell Lock




Your Felhunter will cast Spell Lock when it is off cooldown.
docs.title: cooldown / nocooldown

docs.text:
This condition will only fire when the given name of a spell or item is
off/on cooldown.
docs.title: cooldown / nocooldown

docs.text: The name of the spell. White spaces must be replaced with an underscore  _ .
docs.title: Parameters

docs.text: /cast [nocooldown:Spell_Lock] Spell Lock  Your Felhunter will cast Spell Lock when it is off cooldown.
docs.title: Examples

docs.text:
dead / nodead


May only be used when your target is dead. Can be inverted by adding 
no
 in
front of 
dead
.


Examples:


/cast [dead] Resurrection; Flash Heal




Will cast Resurrection if your current target is dead. If it isn't you will cast Flash Heal instead.




/cast [nodead] Flash Heal; Resurrection




The same as above just the other way around.
docs.title: dead / nodead

docs.text:
May only be used when your target is dead. Can be inverted by adding  no  in
front of  dead .
docs.title: dead / nodead

docs.text: /cast [dead] Resurrection; Flash Heal  Will cast Resurrection if your current target is dead. If it isn't you will cast Flash Heal instead.   /cast [nodead] Flash Heal; Resurrection  The same as above just the other way around.
docs.title: Examples:

docs.text:
equipped


Ensures that the given item type is equipped.


Parameters


May take a single parameter from the following list:




Daggers - Looks for a dagger in your mainhand


Fists - Looks for a fist weapon in your mainhand


Axes - Looks for an axe in your mainhand


Swords - Looks for a sword in your mainhand


Staffs - Looks for a staff in your mainhand


Maces - Looks for a mace in your mainhand


Polearms - Looks for a polearm in your mainhand


Shields - Looks for a shield in your offhand


Guns - Looks for a gun in your ranged slot


Crossbows - Looks for a crossbow in your ranged slot


Bows - Looks for a cow in your ranged slot


Thrown - Looks for a thrown weapon in your ranged slot


Wands - Looks for a wand in your ranged slot




Examples


/cast [equipped:Bows] Shoot Bow; [equipped:Crossbows] Shoot Crossbow; [equipped:Guns] Shoot Gun; [equipped:Thrown] Throw




Will use your ranged shoot ability depending on what ranged weapon you
currently have equipped.
docs.title: equipped

docs.text: Ensures that the given item type is equipped.
docs.title: equipped

docs.text: May take a single parameter from the following list:   Daggers - Looks for a dagger in your mainhand  Fists - Looks for a fist weapon in your mainhand  Axes - Looks for an axe in your mainhand  Swords - Looks for a sword in your mainhand  Staffs - Looks for a staff in your mainhand  Maces - Looks for a mace in your mainhand  Polearms - Looks for a polearm in your mainhand  Shields - Looks for a shield in your offhand  Guns - Looks for a gun in your ranged slot  Crossbows - Looks for a crossbow in your ranged slot  Bows - Looks for a cow in your ranged slot  Thrown - Looks for a thrown weapon in your ranged slot  Wands - Looks for a wand in your ranged slot
docs.title: Parameters

docs.text:
/cast [equipped:Bows] Shoot Bow; [equipped:Crossbows] Shoot Crossbow; [equipped:Guns] Shoot Gun; [equipped:Thrown] Throw  Will use your ranged shoot ability depending on what ranged weapon you
currently have equipped.
docs.title: Examples

docs.text:
group


This condition will only fire when you're in a party or raid.


Parameters


May take one of the following parameters:




party - You must be in a party


raid - You must be in a raid




Examples


/cast [group:party] Arcane Brilliance; [group:raid] Arcane Intellect




This macro will cast Arcane Brilliance when you are in a party. It will cast Arcane Intellect instead when you are in a raid.
docs.title: group

docs.text: This condition will only fire when you're in a party or raid.
docs.title: group

docs.text: May take one of the following parameters:   party - You must be in a party  raid - You must be in a raid
docs.title: Parameters

docs.text: /cast [group:party] Arcane Brilliance; [group:raid] Arcane Intellect  This macro will cast Arcane Brilliance when you are in a party. It will cast Arcane Intellect instead when you are in a raid.
docs.title: Examples

docs.text:
help / harm


The [help] condition is true when the unit can receive a beneficial effect,
e.g., a healing spell. The [harm] condition is true when the unit would get an
adverse effect, e.g., a damaging spell.


Example:


/cast [harm] Frost Shock; [help] Healing Wave




This will cast Frost Shock on hostile targets and Healing Wave on friendly targets.
docs.title: help / harm

docs.text:
The [help] condition is true when the unit can receive a beneficial effect,
e.g., a healing spell. The [harm] condition is true when the unit would get an
adverse effect, e.g., a damaging spell.
docs.title: help / harm

docs.text: /cast [harm] Frost Shock; [help] Healing Wave  This will cast Frost Shock on hostile targets and Healing Wave on friendly targets.
docs.title: Example:

docs.text:
[my]hp


Checks whether or not you (myhp) or the specified target (hp) has the given amount of hit points.


Parameters


A less than 
 or greater than 
 sign followed by the percentage of hp that
is required.


Examples


/cast [myhp
40 @player] Flash Heal; Flash heal




Will cast Flash Heal either on yourself, when you have less than 40% health, or
on your current target if you have more hp.




/cast [hp
20] Execute; Bloodthirst




Will cast Bloodthirst until your target has less than 20% health. At that point
the macro will only cast Execute.
docs.title: [my]hp

docs.text: Checks whether or not you (myhp) or the specified target (hp) has the given amount of hit points.
docs.title: [my]hp

docs.text:
A less than   or greater than   sign followed by the percentage of hp that
is required.
docs.title: Parameters

docs.text:
/cast [myhp 40 @player] Flash Heal; Flash heal  Will cast Flash Heal either on yourself, when you have less than 40% health, or
on your current target if you have more hp.   /cast [hp 20] Execute; Bloodthirst  Will cast Bloodthirst until your target has less than 20% health. At that point
the macro will only cast Execute.
docs.title: Examples

docs.text:
isnpc


This condition will only fire when the specified UnitID is a npc.


Parameters


The target's UnitID. Refer to 
target condition
.


Examples


/cast [isnpc:target] {Yes}




This will execute the Macro with the name 
Yes
 if your target is a npc.
docs.title: isnpc

docs.text: This condition will only fire when the specified UnitID is a npc.
docs.title: isnpc

docs.text: The target's UnitID. Refer to  target condition .
docs.title: Parameters

docs.title: Examples

docs.text:
isplayer


This condition will only fire when the specified UnitID is a player.


Parameters


The target's UnitID. Refer to

.


Examples


/cast [isplayer:target] {Yes}




This will execute the Macro with the name 
Yes
 if your target is a player.
docs.title: isplayer

docs.text: This condition will only fire when the specified UnitID is a player.
docs.title: isplayer

docs.text: The target's UnitID. Refer to  target condition .
docs.title: Parameters

docs.text: /cast [isplayer:target] {Yes}  This will execute the Macro with the name  Yes  if your target is a player.
docs.title: Examples

docs.text:
mod


Modifier keys are a convenient way to save action bar space and make certain
decisions.


Parameters


May take a number of parameters seperated by slashes 
/
.




ctrl - the CTRL key is pressed down


shift - the SHIFT key is pressed down


alt - the ALT key is pressed down




Examples:


/cast [mod:ctrl] Healing Wave; Healing Wave (Rank 1)




This will cast your highest rank of Healing Wave whenever you have the CTRL key pressed, otherwise Healing Wave rank 1.




/cast [mod:ctrl/shift] Healing Wave




You will cast Healing Wave when you have CTRL and SHIFT pressed.
docs.title: mod

docs.text:
Modifier keys are a convenient way to save action bar space and make certain
decisions.
docs.title: mod

docs.text: May take a number of parameters seperated by slashes  / .   ctrl - the CTRL key is pressed down  shift - the SHIFT key is pressed down  alt - the ALT key is pressed down
docs.title: Parameters

docs.text: /cast [mod:ctrl] Healing Wave; Healing Wave (Rank 1)  This will cast your highest rank of Healing Wave whenever you have the CTRL key pressed, otherwise Healing Wave rank 1.   /cast [mod:ctrl/shift] Healing Wave  You will cast Healing Wave when you have CTRL and SHIFT pressed.
docs.title: Examples:

docs.text:
party


The condition will only fire when your target is in your party.


Examples


/cast [party] Arcane Brilliance; Arcane Intellect




This macro will cast Arcane Brilliance when your current target is in your
party. If your target isn't, it will cast Arcane Intellect on it instead.
docs.title: party

docs.text: The condition will only fire when your target is in your party.
docs.title: party

docs.text:
/cast [party] Arcane Brilliance; Arcane Intellect  This macro will cast Arcane Brilliance when your current target is in your
party. If your target isn't, it will cast Arcane Intellect on it instead.
docs.title: Examples

docs.text:
[my]power / [my]rawpower


Checks whether or not you (mypower) or the specified target (power) has the
given amount of its power type.


Parameters


A less than 
 or greater than 
 sign followed by the amount of actual power
([my]rawpower) or the percentage ([my]power) that is required.


Examples


/cast [mypower
60] Heroic Strike




Will cast Heroic Strike when you have more than 60% rage.




/cast [harm @target power
10] Mana Burn




Will cast Mana Burn as long as your current target has more than 10% power.




/cast [myrawpower
390] Arcane Explosion(Rank 1); Arcane Explosion




Will cast max rank Arcane Explosion as long as you have the mana to do so and
will cast Arcane Explosion Rank 1 when you don't.
docs.title: [my]power / [my]rawpower

docs.text:
Checks whether or not you (mypower) or the specified target (power) has the
given amount of its power type.
docs.title: [my]power / [my]rawpower

docs.text:
A less than   or greater than   sign followed by the amount of actual power
([my]rawpower) or the percentage ([my]power) that is required.
docs.title: Parameters

docs.text:
/cast [mypower 60] Heroic Strike  Will cast Heroic Strike when you have more than 60% rage.   /cast [harm @target power 10] Mana Burn  Will cast Mana Burn as long as your current target has more than 10% power.   /cast [myrawpower 390] Arcane Explosion(Rank 1); Arcane Explosion  Will cast max rank Arcane Explosion as long as you have the mana to do so and
will cast Arcane Explosion Rank 1 when you don't.
docs.title: Examples

docs.text:
raid


The condition will only fire when your target is in your raid.


Examples


/cast [raid] Arcane Brilliance; Arcane Intellect




This macro will cast Arcane Brilliance when your current target is in your
raid. If your target isn't, it will cast Arcane Intellect on it instead.
docs.title: raid

docs.text: The condition will only fire when your target is in your raid.
docs.title: raid

docs.text:
/cast [raid] Arcane Brilliance; Arcane Intellect  This macro will cast Arcane Brilliance when your current target is in your
raid. If your target isn't, it will cast Arcane Intellect on it instead.
docs.title: Examples

docs.text:
stance


Allows you to check whether or not you are in the given stance or shapeshift
form.


Parameters


May take a number of parameters seperated by slashes 
/
.




0 - You're in no stance


1, 2, ..., n - You're in stance 1, 2, ..., n where n is the total number of
stances or shapeshift form availlable




Examples


/cast [stance:0] Cat Form




Enter Cat Form when not shapeshifted.




/cast [stance:1] Enrage; Dire Bear Form




This macro will cast Enrage if you are in your (Dire) Bear Form. If not it will
go into said Form.




/cast [stance:1/2] Shield Bash; Defensive Stance




If you are in either the Battle Stance or the Defensive Stance, you will cast
Shield Bash. If you are in the Berserker Stance, however, you will switch into
Defensive Stance.
docs.title: stance

docs.text:
Allows you to check whether or not you are in the given stance or shapeshift
form.
docs.title: stance

docs.text:
May take a number of parameters seperated by slashes  / .   0 - You're in no stance  1, 2, ..., n - You're in stance 1, 2, ..., n where n is the total number of
stances or shapeshift form availlable
docs.title: Parameters

docs.text:
/cast [stance:0] Cat Form  Enter Cat Form when not shapeshifted.   /cast [stance:1] Enrage; Dire Bear Form  This macro will cast Enrage if you are in your (Dire) Bear Form. If not it will
go into said Form.   /cast [stance:1/2] Shield Bash; Defensive Stance  If you are in either the Battle Stance or the Defensive Stance, you will cast
Shield Bash. If you are in the Berserker Stance, however, you will switch into
Defensive Stance.
docs.title: Examples

docs.text:
stealth / nostealth


The condition will only pass when your character is stealthed. May be inverted by adding 
no
 in front of 
stealth
.


Example


/cast [stealth @player] Healing Touch; Shadowmeld




If your character is stealthed, he or she will cast Healing Touch. If your character is not stealthed, Shadowmeld will be cast instead.
docs.title: stealth / nostealth

docs.text: The condition will only pass when your character is stealthed. May be inverted by adding  no  in front of  stealth .
docs.title: stealth / nostealth

docs.text: /cast [stealth @player] Healing Touch; Shadowmeld  If your character is stealthed, he or she will cast Healing Touch. If your character is not stealthed, Shadowmeld will be cast instead.
docs.title: Example

docs.text:
UnitID


An identifier that refers to a unit int he game world that can be interacted
with. Available identifiers are:




@player
 - The current player (You!)


@pet
 - The current player's pet


@partyN
 - The Nth party member excluding the player (N is 1, 2, 3 or 4)


@partypetN
 - The pet of the Nth party member (N is 1, 2, 3 or 4)


@raidN
 - The Nth raid member (N is 1, 2, 3, ..., 40)


@raidpetN
 - The pet of the Nth raid member (N is 1, 2, 3, ..., 40)


@target
 - The currently targetted unit


@mouseover
 - The unit which the mouse is currently hovering over (May be
incompatible with some unit frames. Refer to the 
Compatibility Notes
.


@npc
 - The NPC with which the player is currently interacting.




You may append 
target
 to any of these to refer to that unit's target. You may
even chain them together like 
@playertargettargettarget
, but you'll notice an
attendant performance hit if you overdo it.


Examples


/cast [harm @target] Frost Shock; [help @mouseover] Healing Wave




You will cast Frost Shock on your current target if it is considered hostile.
If it isn't and your mouseover target is considered friendly, your character
will cast Healing Wave on your mouseover target instead.




/cast [@mouseover] Flash Heal; [@focus] Flash Heal




Casts Flash Heal if you have a mouseover target. Casts Flash Heal on your focus
target if you don't (Refer to the 
Compatibility Notes
).
docs.title: UnitID

docs.text:
An identifier that refers to a unit int he game world that can be interacted
with. Available identifiers are:   @player  - The current player (You!)  @pet  - The current player's pet  @partyN  - The Nth party member excluding the player (N is 1, 2, 3 or 4)  @partypetN  - The pet of the Nth party member (N is 1, 2, 3 or 4)  @raidN  - The Nth raid member (N is 1, 2, 3, ..., 40)  @raidpetN  - The pet of the Nth raid member (N is 1, 2, 3, ..., 40)  @target  - The currently targetted unit  @mouseover  - The unit which the mouse is currently hovering over (May be
incompatible with some unit frames. Refer to the  Compatibility Notes .  @npc  - The NPC with which the player is currently interacting.   You may append  target  to any of these to refer to that unit's target. You may
even chain them together like  @playertargettargettarget , but you'll notice an
attendant performance hit if you overdo it.
docs.title: UnitID

docs.text:
/cast [harm @target] Frost Shock; [help @mouseover] Healing Wave  You will cast Frost Shock on your current target if it is considered hostile.
If it isn't and your mouseover target is considered friendly, your character
will cast Healing Wave on your mouseover target instead.   /cast [@mouseover] Flash Heal; [@focus] Flash Heal  Casts Flash Heal if you have a mouseover target. Casts Flash Heal on your focus
target if you don't (Refer to the  Compatibility Notes ).
docs.title: Examples

docs.text:
type


Checks whether the target of our action has the given CreatureTypeId.


Parameters


These CreatureTypeIds are available:




Beast


Critter


Demon


Dragonkin


Elemental


Giant


Humanoid


Mechanical


Not_Specified


Totem


Undead




You may also use your respective localized names instead.


Note:
 I've taken the localized names from the legion version of wowwiki, so they may be incorrect. If you spot any mistakes, please forward the correctly localized names to me!


Examples


/cast [@target type:Beast] Hibernate; Entangling Roots




Will cast Hibernate if your current target is a Beast. If not Entangling Roots will be cast instead.
docs.title: type

docs.text: Checks whether the target of our action has the given CreatureTypeId.
docs.title: type

docs.text: These CreatureTypeIds are available:   Beast  Critter  Demon  Dragonkin  Elemental  Giant  Humanoid  Mechanical  Not_Specified  Totem  Undead   You may also use your respective localized names instead.  Note:  I've taken the localized names from the legion version of wowwiki, so they may be incorrect. If you spot any mistakes, please forward the correctly localized names to me!
docs.title: Parameters

docs.text: /cast [@target type:Beast] Hibernate; Entangling Roots  Will cast Hibernate if your current target is a Beast. If not Entangling Roots will be cast instead.
docs.title: Examples

docs.text:
Invoking other Macros


This Addon provides you with the ability to invoke other Macros from within you
own Macros!


This allows for very interesting things like chaining together very complicated
Macros that each check for certain conditions before they are executed. To
execute another Macro, you have to put the name of the Macro in curly braces

{
 
}
 after any chat command that is supported by this Addon.


Example


Macro 1: 
Master


/cast {Blood}
/cast {WW}
/cast {Heroic}




Macro 2: 
Blood


/cast [mypower
30] Bloodthirst




Macro 3: 
WW


/cast [mypower
25] Whirlwind




Macro 4: 
Heroic


/cast [mypower
60 harm] Heroic Strike




You can now use Macro 1 
Master
 to execute all the other Macros respectively.


Invoking Macros may succeed or fail


The master Macro that attempts to execute another child Macro also knows
whether the executed Macro has succeeded if you're using conditions in the
child Macro. This allows you to build very complicated recursive constructs!


Example


Macro 1: 
Hawk


/cast {Monkey}; [nomybuff:Aspect_of_the_Hawk] Aspect of the Hawk




Macro 2: 
Monkey


/cast [nomybuff:Aspect_of_the_Monkey] Aspect of the Monkey




When you now use Macro 1 
Hawk
, the macro will call Macro 2 
Monkey
 and check
if it succeeded. Macro 2 will only succeed if the player doesn't have the

Aspect of the Monkey
 buff active. If he does, the Macro will fail and the
second part of Macro 1 
Hawk
 will be executed!
docs.title: Invoking Macros

docs.text:
This Addon provides you with the ability to invoke other Macros from within you
own Macros!  This allows for very interesting things like chaining together very complicated
Macros that each check for certain conditions before they are executed. To
execute another Macro, you have to put the name of the Macro in curly braces {   }  after any chat command that is supported by this Addon.
docs.title: Invoking other Macros
Example

docs.text:
The master Macro that attempts to execute another child Macro also knows
whether the executed Macro has succeeded if you're using conditions in the
child Macro. This allows you to build very complicated recursive constructs!
docs.title: Invoking Macros may succeed or fail

docs.text:
Macro 1:  Hawk  /cast {Monkey}; [nomybuff:Aspect_of_the_Hawk] Aspect of the Hawk  Macro 2:  Monkey  /cast [nomybuff:Aspect_of_the_Monkey] Aspect of the Monkey  When you now use Macro 1  Hawk , the macro will call Macro 2  Monkey  and check
if it succeeded. Macro 2 will only succeed if the player doesn't have the Aspect of the Monkey  buff active. If he does, the Macro will fail and the
second part of Macro 1  Hawk  will be executed!
docs.title: Example

docs.text:
The #showtooltip instruction


You can re-enable tooltips using the #showtooltip [item name or spell name]
instruction.


Examples


#showtooltip Cone of Cold(Rank 1)
/cast [mypower
200] Cone of Cold(Rank 1)




#showtooltip  Mish'undare, Circlet of the Mind Flayer
/use Linen Bandage
docs.title: The #showtooltip instruction

docs.text:
You can re-enable tooltips using the #showtooltip [item name or spell name]
instruction.
docs.title: The #showtooltip instruction

docs.text:
#showtooltip Cone of Cold(Rank 1)
/cast [mypower 200] Cone of Cold(Rank 1)  #showtooltip  Mish'undare, Circlet of the Mind Flayer
/use Linen Bandage
docs.title: Examples

docs.text:
Toggleable abilities and channelled spells


This AddOn allows you to ensure that channelled spells aren't cast again until
they're finished or interrupted. In addition, this also works for auto
attacking, shooting wands or shooting ranged weapons. This can be done by
putting an exclamation mark at the beginning of the spells name.


Examples


/cast !Mind Flay




You may now spam that button and Mind Flay will only be re-cast when the last
one has finished or gets interrupted.




/cast !Attack




/cast !Shoot




/cast !Auto Shot




Again, using this macro will ensure that your Attack ability is active without deactivating it.
docs.title: Toggleable abilities and channelled spells

docs.text:
This AddOn allows you to ensure that channelled spells aren't cast again until
they're finished or interrupted. In addition, this also works for auto
attacking, shooting wands or shooting ranged weapons. This can be done by
putting an exclamation mark at the beginning of the spells name.
docs.title: Toggleable abilities and channelled spells

docs.text:
/cast !Mind Flay  You may now spam that button and Mind Flay will only be re-cast when the last
one has finished or gets interrupted.   /cast !Attack  /cast !Shoot  /cast !Auto Shot  Again, using this macro will ensure that your Attack ability is active without deactivating it.
docs.title: Examples

docs.text:
Compatibility Notes


UnitFrames


Currently, the following UnitFrames have been tested and are compatible with
this AddOn:




agUnitFrames


Blizzard's UnitFrames


CT_RaidAssist


CT_UnitFrames


DiscordUnitFrames


FocusFrame


Grid


LunaUnitFrames


NotGrid


PerfectRaid


pfUI


sRaidFrames


UnitFramesImproved_Vanilla


XPerl




Note
: If your AddOn is not on this list, please give it a try anyway! I've
implemented this in a way where it very well might work in your UnitFrames
AddOn as well! And if it doesn't please file an Issue and I'll try to add it asap.


Action Bars


Currently, the following Action Bars have been tested and are compatible with
this Addon:




Blizzard's Action Bars


Discord Action Bars




Note
: If your AddOn is not on this list, please give it a try anyway! I've
implemented this in a way where it very well might work in your Action Bars
AddOn as well! And if it doesn't please file an Issue and I'll try to add it asap.


Supported Addons


ClassicFocus / FocusFrame


Using one of these two Addons allows you to make use of the 
@focus
 target
condition!


Known Bugs and work arounds


Gray button fix


In order to fix the range and cooldown check (gray buttons), you have to write
this line at the top of each macro:


/script if nil then CastSpellByName(
SPELLNAME
); end




Make sure to replace SPELLNAME with the actual name of your spell.


/script if nil then CastSpellByName(
Chain Heal
); end
/cast [@target help mod:alt] Chain Heal; Chain Heal(Rank 1)






Note:
 There is currently no way to make this work for different spells
depending on conditions.


/script if nil then CastSpellByName(
Chain Heal
); end
/cast [@target help] Chain Heal; Frost Shock




This will only activate the range and cooldown check for Chain Heal and not
check Frost Shock at all! This appears to be a limitation with the API and I
don't see a way of fixing this. Please contact me if you do!
docs.title: Compatibility Notes

implemented this in a way where it very well might work in your UnitFrames
AddOn as well! And if it doesn't please file an Issue and I'll try to add it asap.
